docs.snippet: Guarantor UniCredit is considering whether to delay Banca Popolare di Vicenza's 1.76-billion euro ($20 billion) rights issue, currently slated for April, if market conditions do not improve, three sources close to the matter said.
docs.lead_paragraph: Guarantor UniCredit is considering whether to delay Banca Popolare di Vicenza's 1.76-billion euro ($20 billion) rights issue, currently slated for April, if market conditions do not improve, three sources close to the matter said.

headline.main: UniCredit Could Delay Popolare Di Vicenza Cash Call-Sources
headline.print_headline: UniCredit Could Delay Popolare Di Vicenza Cash Call-Sources

docs.snippet: To commemorate the centenary of Alberto Ginastera's birth, orchestras around the world are delving into his opus.

docs.snippet: Burger King France's owner has decided to put its Quick burger chain in Belgium and Luxembourg up for sale, a source close to the deal said on Wednesday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Burger King France's owner has decided to put its Quick burger chain in Belgium and Luxembourg up for sale, a source close to the deal said on Wednesday.

headline.main: Burger King France to Sell Belgian Quick Restaurants
headline.print_headline: Burger King France to Sell Belgian Quick Restaurants

docs.snippet: OPEC oil output is rising in March, a Reuters survey found, as higher supply from Iran after the lifting of sanctions and near-record exports from southern Iraq offset maintenance and outages in smaller producers.
docs.lead_paragraph: OPEC oil output is rising in March, a Reuters survey found, as higher supply from Iran after the lifting of sanctions and near-record exports from southern Iraq offset maintenance and outages in smaller producers.

headline.main: OPEC Oil Output Rises in March as Iran, Iraq Growth Offsets Outages
headline.print_headline: OPEC Oil Output Rises in March as Iran, Iraq Growth Offsets Outages

docs.snippet: Italy plans to ask banks to help reimburse thousands of people who lost their savings last year in a state rescue of four small lenders, a government source said on Wednesday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Italy plans to ask banks to help reimburse thousands of people who lost their savings last year in a state rescue of four small lenders, a government source said on Wednesday.

headline.main: Italy Looks to Banks to Help Reimburse Savers Hit in Bank Rescue-Source
headline.print_headline: Italy Looks to Banks to Help Reimburse Savers Hit in Bank Rescue-Source

docs.snippet: Five days before Turkey is due to begin taking back illegal migrants from Greece under a deal with the European Union, neither side is fully ready, with officials scrambling to be able to make at least a symbolic start as new arrivals rise.
docs.lead_paragraph: Five days before Turkey is due to begin taking back illegal migrants from Greece under a deal with the European Union, neither side is fully ready, with officials scrambling to be able to make at least a symbolic start as new arrivals rise.

headline.main: Turkey, Greece Scramble to Start EU Deal as Migrant Arrivals Rise
headline.print_headline: Turkey, Greece Scramble to Start EU Deal as Migrant Arrivals Rise

docs.snippet: The Fullscreen media company is expanding its role beyond cultivating young video stars by launching a subscription video-on-demand service whose programming will draw on homegrown talent as well as content from a range of outside producers.

docs.snippet: French judicial authorities are investigating the husband of former Areva chief executive Anne Lauvergeon for insider trading and money laundering over Areva's purchase of Canadian mining group Uramin in 2007, a judicial source said on Wednesday.

headline.print_headline: Former Areva CEO's Husband Under Investigation for Insider Trading-Source

docs.snippet: Early indications of stronger-than-expected sales of new Galaxy S7 smartphones suggest technology giant Samsung Electronics Co Ltd is emerging from a two-year decline at its flagship mobile business.

docs.snippet: Brussels police have launched a disciplinary inquiry following last week's suicide bombings, after a newspaper reported that a senior officer appeared drunk and incapable at a crisis meeting just after the attacks.
docs.lead_paragraph: Brussels police have launched a disciplinary inquiry following last week's suicide bombings, after a newspaper reported that a senior officer appeared drunk and incapable at a crisis meeting just after the attacks.

headline.main: Brussels Police Investigate 'Drunk' Officer After Attacks
